alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Carroll and northwestern Heard Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Tyus to near Tennant, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Bowdon, Whitesburg, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Tyus, Roosterville, Seaton Lake, Clem, Frolona, Lowell, Plant Wansley, and Blackjack Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
